channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: UDE: A Unified Driving Engine for Human Motion Generation
item.description: Generating controllable and editable human motion sequences is a key challenge in 3D Avatar generation.

item.title: Procedural Image Programs for Representation Learning
item.description: Learning image representations using synthetic data allows training neural networks without some of the concerns associated with real images, such as privacy and bias.

item.title: Beyond Ensemble Averages: Leveraging Climate Model Ensembles for Subseasonal Forecasting
item.description: This paper further includes an investigation of feature importance, trade-offs between using the full ensemble or only the ensemble average, and different modes of accounting for spatial variability.

item.title: Disentangling the Mechanisms Behind Implicit Regularization in SGD
item.description: A number of competing hypotheses have been proposed to explain why small-batch Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD)leads to improved generalization over the full-batch regime, with recent work crediting the implicit regularization of various quantities throughout training.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks: A Powerful and Versatile Tool for Advancing Design, Reliability, and Security of ICs
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have pushed the state-of-the-art (SOTA) for performance in learning and predicting on large-scale data present in social networks, biology, etc.

item.title: Improving Commonsense in Vision-Language Models via Knowledge Graph Riddles
item.description: Through our analysis, we find one important reason is that existing large-scale VL datasets do not contain much commonsense knowledge, which motivates us to improve the commonsense of VL-models from the data perspective.

item.title: End-to-End Neural Discourse Deixis Resolution in Dialogue
item.description: We adapt Lee et al.'s (2018) span-based entity coreference model to the task of end-to-end discourse deixis resolution in dialogue, specifically by proposing extensions to their model that exploit task-specific characteristics.

item.title: Compressing Volumetric Radiance Fields to 1 MB
item.description: Approximating radiance fields with volumetric grids is one of promising directions for improving NeRF, represented by methods like Plenoxels and DVGO, which achieve super-fast training convergence and real-time rendering.

item.title: TyDiP: A Dataset for Politeness Classification in Nine Typologically Diverse Languages
item.description: We study politeness phenomena in nine typologically diverse languages.

item.title: Zero-Shot Opinion Summarization with GPT-3
item.description: Very large language models such as GPT-3 have shown impressive performance across a wide variety of tasks, including text summarization.

item.title: Taming a Generative Model
item.description: Our method can be used in the context of privacy, e. g., removing a specific person from the output of a model, and also in the context of de-biasing by forcing a model to output specific image categories according to a given target distribution.

item.title: Lifelong Person Re-Identification via Knowledge Refreshing and Consolidation
item.description: Lifelong person re-identification (LReID) is in significant demand for real-world development as a large amount of ReID data is captured from diverse locations over time and cannot be accessed at once inherently.

item.title: Bayesian Simultaneous Factorization and Prediction Using Multi-Omic Data
item.description: We show via simulation that BSFP is competitive in recovering latent variation structure, as well as the importance of propagating uncertainty from the estimated factorization to prediction.

item.title: Robustness Disparities in Face Detection
item.description: Many existing algorithmic audits examine the performance of these systems on later stage elements of facial analysis systems like facial recognition and age, emotion, or perceived gender prediction; however, a core component to these systems has been vastly understudied from a fairness perspective: face detection, sometimes called face localization.

item.title: PatchMatch-Stereo-Panorama, a fast dense reconstruction from 360° video images
item.description: This work proposes a new method for real-time dense 3d reconstruction for common 360{\deg} action cams, which can be mounted on small scouting UAVs during USAR missions.

item.title: DiffG-RL: Leveraging Difference between State and Common Sense
item.description: We propose a novel agent, DiffG-RL, which constructs a Difference Graph that organizes the environment states and common sense by means of interactive objects with a dedicated graph encoder.

item.title: Linear Causal Disentanglement via Interventions
item.description: A representation is identifiable if both the latent model and the transformation from latent to observed variables are unique.

item.title: Kinematic-aware Hierarchical Attention Network for Human Pose Estimation in Videos
item.description: Previous video-based human pose estimation methods have shown promising results by leveraging aggregated features of consecutive frames.

item.title: Differentiable User Models
item.description: Probabilistic user modeling is essential for building collaborative AI systems within probabilistic frameworks.

item.title: MedalCare-XL: 16,900 healthy and pathological 12 lead ECGs obtained through electrophysiological simulations
item.description: Mechanistic cardiac electrophysiology models allow for personalized simulations of the electrical activity in the heart and the ensuing electrocardiogram (ECG) on the body surface.

item.title: Evaluating Unsupervised Text Classification: Zero-shot and Similarity-based Approaches
item.description: Text classification of unseen classes is a challenging Natural Language Processing task and is mainly attempted using two different types of approaches.

item.title: Offline Supervised Learning V.S. Online Direct Policy Optimization: A Comparative Study and A Unified Training Paradigm for Neural Network-Based Optimal Feedback Control
item.description: We first conduct a comparative study of two mainstream approaches: offline supervised learning and online direct policy optimization.

item.title: Lifelong Embedding Learning and Transfer for Growing Knowledge Graphs
item.description: We consider knowledge transfer and retention of the learning on growing snapshots of a KG without having to learn embeddings from scratch.

item.title: Three-stage binarization of color document images based on discrete wavelet transform and generative adversarial networks
item.description: In this paper, a three-stage method is proposed for image enhancement and binarization of degraded color document images by using discrete wavelet transform (DWT) and generative adversarial network (GAN).

item.title: ACE: Cooperative Multi-agent Q-learning with Bidirectional Action-Dependency
item.description: In the learning phase, each agent minimizes the TD error that is dependent on how the subsequent agents have reacted to their chosen action.

item.title: A Revenue Function for Comparison-Based Hierarchical Clustering
item.description: Comparison-based learning addresses the problem of learning when, instead of explicit features or pairwise similarities, one only has access to comparisons of the form: \emph{Object $A$ is more similar to $B$ than to $C$.}

item.title: Measuring the Measuring Tools: An Automatic Evaluation of Semantic Metrics for Text Corpora
item.description: The ability to compare the semantic similarity between text corpora is important in a variety of natural language processing applications.

item.title: Extending the Subwording Model of Multilingual Pretrained Models for New Languages
item.description: Multilingual pretrained models are effective for machine translation and cross-lingual processing because they contain multiple languages in one model.

item.title: Finding Front-Door Adjustment Sets in Linear Time
item.description: The advantage of this approach is that it uses observed mediators to identify causal effects, which is possible even in the presence of unobserved confounding.

item.title: BotSIM: An End-to-End Bot Simulation Toolkit for Commercial Task-Oriented Dialog Systems
item.description: BotSIM adopts a layered design comprising the infrastructure layer, the adaptor layer and the application layer.

item.title: An Extreme-Adaptive Time Series Prediction Model Based on Probability-Enhanced LSTM Neural Networks
item.description: Forecasting time series with extreme events has been a challenging and prevalent research topic, especially when the time series data are affected by complicated uncertain factors, such as is the case in hydrologic prediction.

item.title: Guiding Neural Entity Alignment with Compatibility
item.description: Making compatible predictions thus should be one of the goals of training an EA model along with fitting the labelled data: this aspect however is neglected in current methods.

item.title: Inferring Attack Relations for Gradual Semantics
item.description: The main contribution of our work is to demonstrate that the associated decision problem, i. e., whether a set of attacks can exist which allows the final acceptability degrees to occur for given initial weights, is NP-complete for the weighted h-categoriser and cardinality-based semantics, and is polynomial for the weighted max-based semantics, even for the complete version of the problem (where all initial weights and final acceptability degrees are known).

item.title: One is All: Bridging the Gap Between Neural Radiance Fields Architectures with Progressive Volume Distillation
item.description: In this paper, we propose Progressive Volume Distillation (PVD), a systematic distillation method that allows any-to-any conversions between different architectures, including MLP, sparse or low-rank tensors, hashtables and their compositions.

item.title: Dependency-aware Self-training for Entity Alignment
item.description: Entity Alignment (EA), which aims to detect entity mappings (i. e. equivalent entity pairs) in different Knowledge Graphs (KGs), is critical for KG fusion.

item.title: Language-driven Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Understanding
item.description: Open-vocabulary scene understanding aims to localize and recognize unseen categories beyond the annotated label space.

item.title: Intra-class Adaptive Augmentation with Neighbor Correction for Deep Metric Learning
item.description: They have overlooked the wide characteristic changes of different classes and can not model abundant intra-class variations for generations.

item.title: Curriculum Temperature for Knowledge Distillation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a simple curriculum-based technique, termed Curriculum Temperature for Knowledge Distillation (CTKD), which controls the task difficulty level during the student's learning career through a dynamic and learnable temperature.

item.title: BARTSmiles: Generative Masked Language Models for Molecular Representations
item.description: We then quantitatively show that when applied to the molecular domain, the BART objective learns representations that implicitly encode our downstream tasks of interest.

item.title: AutoCAD: Automatically Generating Counterfactuals for Mitigating Shortcut Learning
item.description: Recent studies have shown the impressive efficacy of counterfactually augmented data (CAD) for reducing NLU models' reliance on spurious features and improving their generalizability.

item.title: Towards More Robust Interpretation via Local Gradient Alignment
item.description: However, the lack of considering the normalization of the attributions, which is essential in their visualizations, has been an obstacle to understanding and improving the robustness of feature attribution methods.

item.title: Analysis of Training Object Detection Models with Synthetic Data
item.description: The downside of this technique is that the so-called domain gap between the real target images and synthetic training data leads to a decrease in performance.

item.title: AdsorbML: Accelerating Adsorption Energy Calculations with Machine Learning
item.description: Computational catalysis is playing an increasingly significant role in the design of catalysts across a wide range of applications.

item.title: Which Shortcut Solution Do Question Answering Models Prefer to Learn?
item.description: We assume that the learnability of shortcuts, i. e., how easy it is to learn a shortcut, is useful to mitigate the problem.

item.title: Fourier-Net: Fast Image Registration with Band-limited Deformation
item.description: Specifically, instead of our Fourier-Net learning to output a full-resolution displacement field in the spatial domain, we learn its low-dimensional representation in a band-limited Fourier domain.

item.title: Challenging the Universal Representation of Deep Models for 3D Point Cloud Registration
item.description: Learning universal representations across different applications domain is an open research problem.

item.title: A Visual Active Search Framework for Geospatial Exploration
item.description: We model this class of problems in a visual active search (VAS) framework, which takes as input an image of a broad area, and aims to identify as many examples of a target object as possible.

item.title: PyTorch Adapt
item.description: PyTorch Adapt is a library for domain adaptation, a type of machine learning algorithm that re-purposes existing models to work in new domains.

item.title: Superpoint Transformer for 3D Scene Instance Segmentation
item.description: The key step in this framework is a novel query decoder with transformers that can capture the instance information through the superpoint cross-attention mechanism and generate the superpoint masks of the instances.

item.title: Découvrir de nouvelles classes dans des données tabulaires
item.description: In Novel Class Discovery (NCD), the goal is to find new classes in an unlabeled set given a labeled set of known but different classes.
